How I Got Rid of My Chronic Inflammatory Diseases

Posted 6, April 2018 by
Dr. Dayana Deschamps - 0 min read

I was extremely sick, suffering from different health issues ranging from anxiety and hormonal imbalance to lots of digestive issues, including a bleeding ulcer, I was tired, overweight, and depressed. I discovered old and modern ways through which I got healing, I was healthy again! I became so passionate about this mix of modern and old methods and the results they are capable of giving, so much that I turned it into a career. Today, I want to share my lifestyle and amazing recovery with you; to inspire you to find your own healing abilities. Less talk more action!

Seven Ways to Optimum Health:

1. Diet Change

I recommend starting an anti-inflammatory diet, it should include fresh fruits, vegetables, healthy sprouted grains, and fats; make sure to choose your protein source wisely. It’s best to buy organic and NON-GMO foods. Otherwise, learn to shop by the “dirty dozen and cleanest fifteen lists”. It’s a list that provides information about foods that people don’t have to buy organic. Don’t forget to drink filtered alkaline water.

Learn to cook with anti-inflammatory spices such as curcumin or ginger. Avoid chemicals from foods, drinks, cosmetics and cleaning products as much as you can. Consume natural sources of sugar instead of the unhealthy kind.

You might be asking yourself what this has to with our current topic, but you have to know that if you don’t change your lifestyle your body can become overloaded with toxicity, affecting both the physical and emotional aspect of your life.

2) Get Better Sleep

Many people have trouble sleeping because of the many factors that will be discussed promptly. First of all, your bed is made for sleeping only. The reason for that statement is because some people use their bed to eat. Unless there is a particular reason for such behavior I would advise to use any other sitting area except the bed. Next, check what you’re eating close to bedtime because it might also cause insomnia. Make sure to always check for excess light in the room. If you still have trouble sleeping, the best thing to do is get a proper diagnosis to figure out whether or not you suffer from a mental condition or insomnia.

Last, consider using supplements or herbs. When the body is overactive it might need a boost to help with recovery. Best herbs for mood, sleep problems, and fatigue are chamomile and St. John’s Wort.

3) Try Detoxing Every Year

Detox has become a very popular word in the past few years. The same way that you need to rest when you’re sick or tired, your body needs a rest from toxic overload. If you can’t take a detox don’t force it, you can detox by eating a clean anti-inflammatory diet. You can also use juicing and anti-inflammatory detoxing herbs to cleanse the liver and colon. Best herbs for a liver cleanse are milk thistle, dandelion, and burdock root. Click here to read about Health Benefits of a Colon Cleanse: The 4 Most Effective.

4) Exercise

Exercise regularly or do something you are passionate about. It is not a secret that a sedentary lifestyle can lead to many health conditions. Exercise is important when it comes to health. Not only does it help shape your body, but it also keeps your mind active and sharp. It helps control blood sugar, increase oxygen in the cells, increase the capacity of the lungs, and decrease body weight. Exercise can help you release feel-good hormones, therefore, it can help if you suffer from many emotional conditions. Now, the tricky part is that many people cannot commit to exercise, so I suggest that you find a schedule, routine, and activity that you enjoy.

5) Heal Your Emotions by Inspiring Others

You can use your little imprint to help others that are close to you. Wait a minute… this is exactly what I am doing right now! Find an activity that inspires you and use it to inspire others. I love writing and I use social media to post a supporting message to my readers. Someone I know loves makeup and she uses her knowledge to give hope to others by giving them a free makeover that leaves them speechless and crying.

6) Practice Love

Not everyone can feel grateful and give love when things are tough. It’s not easy if one feels deeply wounded, so learn to see the world differently. Someone who lost her only child to cancer told me that it took her months to come out of her depressive mood. After months of crying, grieving and feeling depressed, she told me that her love for her lost son made her strong. She finally woke up and started to help others because her son would have loved to see her helping others going through the same situation. She is making a difference, that way she can work through her pain. She is giving love so she can receive love.

7) Spend a Little Time with Nature

Nature is a way to feel connected to everything. It doesn’t matter what you’re going through, a walk in the woods can help you feel more alive. I usually suggest hiking, walking, and skiing to my clients, whatever makes them happy. I love driving a little further away from the place I live in. Even in winter, I enjoy the beauty of nature, it never stops amazing me. I also invested in indoor plants, a small fish tank; and a water sound system that keeps me calm and brings me peace.

“Love and believe in yourself. Trust your gut and do something positive today.“

Holistic Modalities The Anti-inflammatory Living
